chief.note: Commissioned to the Federation of the Centre of America.
Commissioned to the Republic of Central of America.
Commissioned to the Republic of Guatemala.
Commissioned to Guatemala.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on February 6, 1866, after confirmation.

ended.note: Notified the Government of Guatemala by note from Amapala, Honduras, that he had resigned

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 10, 1873, after confirmation. Commissioned to “the Central American States.”
Commissioned to “the Central American States.”

ended.note: Promoted to Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary

chief.note: Commissioned to “the Central American States.”
Commissioned to “the Central American States.”
Commissioned to “the Central American States.”

ended.note: Recommissioned to Guatemala and Honduras only

chief.note: Commissioned to “the Central American States.”
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 23, 1891, after confirmation. Did not present credentials again under the new appointment.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 17, 1896, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 18, 1897, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 8, 1902, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 15, 1910, after confirmation.
The new government of Guatemala was still unrecognized by the United States when McMillin left post on January 5, 1922.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 15, 1934, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on March 2, 1949, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 26, 1954, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 3, 1954, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 21, 1960, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 30, 1962, after confirmation.
Commissioned to the Central Republic of America. Died while en route to post.
Commissioned to the Republic of Central America. Reached Central America, but returned to the United States without presenting credentials.
Commissioned to the Republic of Central America. Not commissioned; nomination withdrawn before the Senate acted upon it.
Commissioned to the Republic of Central America. Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; did not proceed to post.
Commissioned to the Republic of Central America. Died en route to post.
Commissioned to the Republic of Guatemala. Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on March 18, 1850, after confirmation, but did not proceed to post.
Did not proceed to post.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate. Commissioned to Central America; declined appointment.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on February 9, 1854, after confirmation. Commissioned to Central America. Did not present credentials in Guatemala.
Nominated on February 25, 1856; nomination withdrawn before the Senate acted upon it.
Died at post before presenting credentials. Commissioned to Guatemala.
Not commissioned; nomination not confirmed by the Senate.
Commissioned to Guatemala; declined appointment.
Took oath of office, but did not proceed to post.
